Articles.Content:
Dear fans of KSP,

Hello, I am a huge space fanatic, and space fan. Recently I've begun working on enlistment into the Air Force, to begin the next step to my ultimate goal of becoming an astronaut. With that, I have had a genius idea. With HOCgaming's recent charity water polar expedition, I decided I wanted to do something similar. I have decided to go to the Mun, but without time acceleration, and with only IVA, and to live stream it for charity. But, I was going to develop a whole space program style development to where I can locate the best landing site, and the best scientific analyses (granted fake science, but just something interesting I can do to help keep it entertaining) I will launch probes, and develop lander's and orbiting spacecraft. How it would go is I would develop a series of probes, developed with stock parts, one series to take photos of the surface going both in an equatorial orbits, and polar orbits. A small series of landing craft, and rovers, each one with their own experiments and equipment. Then, when I have selected a landing site, and developed the lander and orbiting spacecraft. I will live stream the launch, the orbital transition, the landing, and the return, for a charity group, using only IVA, and no time warp. Tell me what you think, I will launch the Pilot mission soon. Stay tooned to see what the plan is. Thank you all.

Signed,

Rocketscience
Make sure you do the mission while remaining inside a box the rough size of the capsule.
If you're using no time warp.. I'd suggest thinking about how to keep your viewers interested on the long flights to the Mun and back..

Launch the "main event" ship first. Then, on a second PC or just a second window if your PC can handle it, open another instance of KSP to do the stuff like landing site selection in (presumably with timewarp). That should help you fill the journey time.
Your ultimate goal shouldn't be to become an astronaut - that should be your penultimate goal, with the ultimate being actually going out to space.

Thank you all for your input. Some things I'd like to do, is speak with other youtubers during the mission. And yes my ultimate goal is astronaut. That is the only other absolute point in my life other than birth and death.
